text: Carter Henry Harrison, Jr. (April 23, 1860 - December 25, 1953) served as Mayor of Chicago (1897–1905 and 1911–1915). As the City's 30th mayor, he was the first mayor actually born in Chicago. His father was Mayor of Chicago, Carter Harrison, Sr.. Carter was born on April 23, 1860 in Chicago, Illinois. His father, Carter Harrison, Sr. was already the mayor but was assassinated while in office. He was married to Edith Ogden. He had two children. Harrison died on December 25, 1953 in Chicago, Illinois from natural causes, aged 93. ==References== ==Other websites== * Mayor Carter Henry Harrison Papers at the Newberry Library Category:1860 births Category:1953 deaths Category:Disease- related deaths in Chicago Category:Burials at Graceland Cemetery Category:Mayors of Chicago Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Carter Harrison Jr.
